title: Get Complaints
text: safecaR package provides tidy interface NHTSA APIs, including crash ratings, recalls, complaints. article focuses complaints API, provides access vehicle recall information reported National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). Using recalls interface, can: List available model years, makes, models Retrieve detailed complaint records individual vehicles functions return tibbles, making easy use data analysis pipelines.

title: Get Complaints
code: # List available years in the NHTSA repository years <- list_complaint_years() head(years) #> # A tibble: 6 × 1 #>   modelYear #>   <chr>     #> 1 1949      #> 2 1955      #> 3 1957      #> 4 1958      #> 5 1959      #> 6 1960

title: Get Complaints
code: # List makes for 2022 makes <- list_complaint_makes(2022) head(makes) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   modelYear make            #>   <chr>     <chr>           #> 1 2022      ACURA           #> 2 2022      AIRSTREAM       #> 3 2022      ALFA ROMEO      #> 4 2022      ALLIANCE RV     #> 5 2022      AMERICAN HAULER #> 6 2022      APRILIA

what: Listing Models for a Make and Year
title: Get Complaints
code: # List models for Acura in 2022 models <- list_complaint_models(2022, "Acura") head(models) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   modelYear make  model #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr> #> 1 2022      ACURA RDX   #> 2 2022      ACURA RDX   #> 3 2022      ACURA MDX   #> 4 2022      ACURA MDX   #> 5 2022      ACURA ILX   #> 6 2022      ACURA TLX

title: Get Complaints
code: complaints <- get_complaints(2022, "ACURA", "RDX") head(complaints) #> # A tibble: 6 × 16 #>   odiNumber manufacturer             crash fire  numberOfInjuries numberOfDeaths #>       <int> <chr>                    <lgl> <lgl>            <int>          <int> #> 1  11684165 Honda (American Honda M… TRUE  FALSE                0              0 #> 2  11656728 Honda (American Honda M… TRUE  FALSE                0              0 #> 3  11637502 Honda (American Honda M… FALSE FALSE                0              0 #> 4  11637044 Honda (American Honda M… FALSE FALSE                0              0 #> 5  11635411 Honda (American Honda M… FALSE FALSE                0              0 #> 6  11634972 Honda (American Honda M… FALSE FALSE                0              0 #> # ℹ 10 more variables: dateOfIncident <chr>, dateComplaintFiled <chr>, #> #   vin <chr>, components <chr>, summary <chr>, products_type <chr>, #> #   products_productYear <chr>, products_productMake <chr>, #> #   products_productModel <chr>, products_manufacturer <chr>

title: Get Complaints
code: complaints <- get_complaints_by_odi_number("11684165") head(complaints) #> # A tibble: 1 × 16 #>   odiNumber manufacturer             crash fire  numberOfInjuries numberOfDeaths #>       <int> <chr>                    <lgl> <lgl>            <int>          <int> #> 1  11684165 Honda (American Honda M… TRUE  FALSE                0              0 #> # ℹ 10 more variables: dateOfIncident <chr>, dateComplaintFiled <chr>, #> #   vin <chr>, components <chr>, summary <chr>, products_type <chr>, #> #   products_productYear <chr>, products_productMake <chr>, #> #   products_productModel <chr>, products_manufacturer <chr>

title: Get Complaints
text: Function inputs case-insensitive. example, “ACURA”, “Acura”, “acura” valid. outputs tidy tibbles easy integration dplyr ggplot2.

title: Get Complaints
Get Crash Ratings
text: safecaR package provides tidy interface NHTSA APIs, including crash ratings, recalls, complaints. article focuses crash ratings API, allows : List available model years, makes, models Explore vehicle variants Retrieve crash test ratings individual vehicles variants model functions return tibbles, making easy use data analysis pipelines.

title: Get Crash Ratings
code: # List available years in the NHTSA repository years <- list_rating_years() head(years) #> # A tibble: 6 × 1 #>   modelYear #>       <int> #> 1      2026 #> 2      2025 #> 3      2024 #> 4      2023 #> 5      2022 #> 6      2021

title: Get Crash Ratings
code: # List makes for 2022 makes <- list_rating_makes(2022) head(makes) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   modelYear make    #>       <int> <chr>   #> 1      2022 ACURA   #> 2      2022 ALFA    #> 3      2022 AUDI    #> 4      2022 BENTLEY #> 5      2022 BMW     #> 6      2022 BUICK

what: Listing Models for a Make and Year
title: Get Crash Ratings
code: # List models for Acura in 2022 models <- list_rating_models(2022, "Acura") head(models) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   modelYear make  model #>       <int> <chr> <chr> #> 1      2022 ACURA ILX   #> 2      2022 ACURA MDX   #> 3      2022 ACURA NSX   #> 4      2022 ACURA RDX   #> 5      2022 ACURA TLX

title: Get Crash Ratings
code: # List all crash-tested variants for a specific model variants <- list_rating_model_variants(2022, "ACURA", "RDX") head(variants) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   vehicleDescription     vehicleId #>   <chr>                      <int> #> 1 2022 Acura RDX SUV AWD     16838 #> 2 2022 Acura RDX SUV FWD     16837

title: Get Crash Ratings
code: # Fetch ratings for a specific VehicleId # Here we use the first variant from the list vehicle_id <- variants$VehicleId[1] #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `VehicleId`.  ratings <- get_ratings(vehicle_id) ratings #> # A tibble: 0 × 0

what: Getting Ratings for All Variants of a Model
title: Get Crash Ratings
code: all_ratings <- get_ratings_by_model("2022", "ACURA", "RDX") head(all_ratings) #> # A tibble: 2 × 34 #>   variant_index overallRating overallFrontCrashRating frontCrashDriversideRating #>   <chr>         <chr>         <chr>                   <chr>                      #> 1 1             5             4                       4                          #> 2 2             5             4                       4                          #> # ℹ 30 more variables: frontCrashPassengersideRating <chr>, #> #   frontCrashPicture <chr>, frontCrashVideo <chr>, #> #   overallSideCrashRating <chr>, sideCrashDriversideRating <chr>, #> #   sideCrashPassengersideRating <chr>, sideCrashPicture <chr>, #> #   sideCrashVideo <chr>, combinedSideBarrierAndPoleRatingFront <chr>, #> #   combinedSideBarrierAndPoleRatingRear <chr>, sideBarrierRatingOverall <chr>, #> #   rolloverRating <chr>, rolloverRating2 <chr>, rolloverPossibility <dbl>, …

previous_headings: Getting Ratings for All Variants of a Model
title: Get Crash Ratings
text: Function inputs case-insensitive. example, “ACURA”, “Acura”, “acura” valid. VehicleId returned variants required fetch detailed safety ratings. outputs tidy tibbles easy integration dplyr ggplot2.

previous_headings: Getting Ratings for All Variants of a Model
title: Get Crash Ratings
Get Recalls
text: safecaR package provides tidy interface NHTSA APIs, including crash ratings, recalls, complaints. article focuses recalls API, provides access vehicle recall information reported National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). Using recalls interface, can: List available model years, makes, models Retrieve detailed recall records individual vehicles functions return tibbles, making easy use data analysis pipelines.

title: Get Recalls
code: # List available years in the NHTSA repository years <- list_recall_years() head(years) #> # A tibble: 6 × 1 #>   modelYear #>   <chr>     #> 1 1949      #> 2 1950      #> 3 1951      #> 4 1952      #> 5 1953      #> 6 1954

title: Get Recalls
code: # List makes for 2022 makes <- list_recall_makes(2022) head(makes) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   modelYear make          #>   <chr>     <chr>         #> 1 2022      4 STAR        #> 2 2022      ABS REMORQUES #> 3 2022      ACURA         #> 4 2022      ADAM          #> 5 2022      AIRSTREAM     #> 6 2022      ALAMO GROUP

what: Listing Models for a Make and Year
title: Get Recalls
code: # List models for Acura in 2022 models <- list_recall_models(2022, "Acura") head(models) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   modelYear make  model #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr> #> 1 2022      ACURA RDX   #> 2 2022      ACURA RDX   #> 3 2022      ACURA MDX   #> 4 2022      ACURA MDX   #> 5 2022      ACURA ILX   #> 6 2022      ACURA TLX

title: Get Recalls
code: recalls <- get_recalls(2022, "ACURA", "RDX") head(recalls) #> # A tibble: 1 × 14 #>   manufacturer           nhtsaCampaignNumber parkIt parkOutSide overTheAirUpdate #>   <chr>                  <chr>               <lgl>  <lgl>       <lgl>            #> 1 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE            #> # ℹ 9 more variables: reportReceivedDate <chr>, component <chr>, summary <chr>, #> #   consequence <chr>, remedy <chr>, notes <chr>, modelYear <chr>, make <chr>, #> #   model <chr>

title: Get Recalls
code: recalls <- get_recalls_by_campaign_number("24V064000") head(recalls) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   manufacturer           nhtsaCampaignNumber parkIt parkOutSide overTheAirUpdate #>   <chr>                  <chr>               <lgl>  <lgl>       <lgl>            #> 1 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE            #> 2 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE            #> 3 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE            #> 4 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE            #> 5 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE            #> 6 Honda (American Honda… 24V064000           FALSE  FALSE       FALSE            #> # ℹ 10 more variables: reportReceivedDate <chr>, component <chr>, #> #   potentialNumberofUnitsAffected <int>, summary <chr>, consequence <chr>, #> #   remedy <chr>, notes <chr>, modelYear <chr>, make <chr>, model <chr>

title: Get Recalls
text: Function inputs case-insensitive. example, “ACURA”, “Acura”, “acura” valid. outputs tidy tibbles easy integration dplyr ggplot2.

title: Get Recalls
Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Astle W (2025). safecaR: Access NHTSA API Vehicle Safety Data. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {safecaR: Access NHTSA API Vehicle Safety Data},   author = {W. Abram Astle},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: The safecaR Package
text: safecaR R package provides tidy interface NHTSA APIs, including crash ratings, recalls, complaints.

title: The safecaR Package
text: can install latest release safecaR Github following:
code: # install.packages("remotes") if you don't have it remotes::install_github("c-a-s-t-l-e/safecaR")

title: The safecaR Package
text: Option #1: Access vehicle crash ratings single vehicle Option #2: Access vehicle crash ratings model variants Option #3: Access vehicle recalls Option #4: Access vehicle complaints Besides file, information like listing available years, makes, models, model variants can found safecaR’s website. ⚠️ Note: package requires internet connection fetch data public NHTSA APIs. ’re offline, functions return results.
code: # uses the NHTSA vehicle ID for 2022 Acura RDX ratings <- get_ratings(7520) head(ratings) ratings_all <- get_ratings_by_model(2022, "ACURA", "RDX") head(ratings_all) recalls <- get_recalls(2022, "ACURA", "RDX") head(recalls) complaints <- get_complaints(2022, "ACURA", "RDX") head(complaints)

what: Perform an HTTP GET request to the NHTSA Safety Ratings API — make_request
title: Perform an HTTP GET request to the NHTSA Safety Ratings API — make_request
text: function sends GET request NHTSA public API returns parsed response tibble. request fails (e.g., due internet connection invalid path), returns empty tibble issues warning.

title: Perform an HTTP GET request to the NHTSA Safety Ratings API — make_request
code: make_request(path, query = list())

title: Perform an HTTP GET request to the NHTSA Safety Ratings API — make_request
text: path character string specifying endpoint path (e.g., "modelyear/2013/make/Acura/model/RDX") query Optional list query parameters include request

title: Perform an HTTP GET request to the NHTSA Safety Ratings API — make_request
text: tibble API response data, empty tibble error

title: Perform an HTTP GET request to the NHTSA Safety Ratings API — make_request
text: function requires internet connection may return   empty result API unavailable.

title: Perform an HTTP GET request to the NHTSA Safety Ratings API — make_request
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ make_request("SafetyRatings/modelyear/2013/make/Acura/model/RDX") } # }

what: Parse raw JSON response from the NHTSA API — parse_response
title: Parse raw JSON response from the NHTSA API — parse_response
text: Parses raw JSON string returned NHTSA API. Extracts 'Results' element (case-insensitive) returns cleaned tibble.

title: Parse raw JSON response from the NHTSA API — parse_response
code: parse_response(response)
